conclusion: To find the magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D during the acceleration process, we'll analyze the forces and motion in the system.
Four identical wooden blocks (A, B, C, D) are placed on a smooth horizontal surface. Blocks B and C are connected by a light spring. A horizontal force F is applied to block B.
All blocks accelerate together with the same acceleration.

premise: The total mass of the system is 4m.

conclusion: Solving for acceleration a: a = F/(4m)

premise: Consider block D. All blocks have the same acceleration a.
conclusion: The static friction force f needed to keep block D moving with the same acceleration is: f = ma
Substitute the expression for a: f = m(F/(4m))

premise: The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D is f = F/4.
conclusion: The magnitude of the static friction force acting on block D during the acceleration process is F/4.
